author: Special Correspondent
text:
Organs retrieved from a brain dead five-year old girl Jana Sruthi of Karur saved six lives.

The organs, retrieved at Kovai Medical Centre Hospital in Coimbatore, were rushed to hospitals in Chennai and Coimbatore.

Accident

According to KMCH, Jana Sruthi, a Standard I student, met with an accident on January 2, when she was going to school along with her mother. She was rushed to hospitals in Coimbatore and then referred to KMCH on Tuesday.

On Wednesday, the girl was declared brain dead and the parents came forward to donate the organs.

A team of doctors from Coimbatore Medical College Hospital and KMCH retrieved the kidneys, heart valve, liver and eyes.

Heart valve, a kidney and liver were taken to Madras Medical Mission, Fortis and Apollo hospitals in Chennai by a special aircraft.

Another kidney was transplanted to a patient at KMCH itself and two eyes were sent to Aravind Eye Hospital.

The girl’s father Thangavelu, employed as a cook at Paramathivelur Government Hospital, said that his daughter will continue to live in the recipients of the organs.

Arun N Palaniswami, Director (quality), KMCH, said that this could perhaps be the first youngest child organ donation outside Chennai.
title: Brain dead girl gives new lease of life to six patients
